response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<String> it = fileContent.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    token = it.next();
    if (token.equals("Table")) {
        System.out.println(token);
        state = 1;
    } else {
        System.err.println("Corrupt file format at state 0: "+ token);
        System.exit(0);
    }
    break;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are modifying the state variable inside the loop, which causes the loop to continue and the next iteration to start with the value of state that was modified. To fix this, you should declare state as a local variable within the if statement, or move the if statement outside of the loop.
